snippet: A recent attack on a female teacher at a girls’ school in Pakistan has revived calls for better security for educators and students. The teacher, Shahnaz Nazli, 41, was shot dead on her way to the school where she worked in the volatile tribal belt...
abstract: A recent attack on a female teacher at a girls’ school in Pakistan has revived calls for better security for educators and students. The teacher, Shahnaz Nazli, 41, was shot dead on her way to the school where she worked in the volatile tribal belt on the Afghan border.

headline.main: With Pakistani Schools Under Fire, Renewed Outrage and Action
